La Liga duo Atletico Madrid and Barcelona are reportedly interested in signing unsettled Chelsea striker Diego Costa. 
The Spain striker was left out of the Blues' squad for the 3-0 win over Leicester at the weekend, as rumours over his future continue to circulate, according to the Independent . 
The 28-year-old has been linked with a move to China, but Barcelona could see him as the man to refresh their strike force, while his former side Atletico fear that Antoine Griezmann is set to move to Manchester United next summer. 
Costa is currently training on his own and is expected to have talks with Blues boss Antonio Conte this week to attempt to sort out his future. 
Here are Monday's other top stories ... Top stories from the Daily Mirror 
Diego Costa is now at loggerheads with Roman Abramovich - after refusing to commit himself to a new deal at Chelsea. Payet has been told to apologise (Photo: West Ham United via Getty Images) 
West Ham have ordered Dimitri Payet to apologise to their fans and show some loyalty to the club after rejecting a fresh bid from Marseille 
Sam Allardyce has confirmed he is edging closer to sealing a reunion with Carl Jenkinson . 
Watford are close to signing Fiorentina’s ex-Birmingham, West Ham and QPR striker Mauro Zarate on loan . 
Striker Patrick Bamford will cost Middlesbrough up to £10million when he completes his move from Chelsea back to Boro, where he has previously been on loan, this week. Patrick Bamford is set to return to Middlesbrough in a £10m deal (Photo: Plumb Images)
